title: Job Openings at Biz Afric Solutions
content:
Biz Afric is all about helping businesses thrive in Africa byassisting them with a wide range of business support services, including human resources, business development, digital strategy, research, data analysis, forecasting, and any other areas of their business needs.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) B2B Sales Executive

Job Location: Abuja (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a passionate sales and business development strategist who is passionate about natural skincare who will leadbusiness growth initiatives, oversee key partnerships.
	This role will be the face of our company, driving market expansion and ensuring strong client relationships across the B2B, B2B2C, and B2C sectors.
	We are seeking a highly motivated, results-driven business Development strategistto help us break into the market and scale our distribution and sales channels.
	This role offers a base salary plus commission, providing unlimited earning potential for the rightcandidate.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and secure new sales opportunities, including retail partnerships (spas, beautystores, online platforms, etc.).
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and distributors.
	Develop and execute structured marketing strategies to boost brand visibility and sales.
	Promote our skincare products through innovative sales and marketing initiatives.
	Attend trade shows, events, and networking opportunities to showcase our products.
	Educate customers and retailers on the benefits of our natural skincare range.
	Consistently meet and exceed sales targets within a commission-based structure.


Requirements


	Proven experience in sales, marketing, or business development (preferably in the beauty/skincare industry).
	Strong networking, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
	Self-motivated, results-oriented, and capable of working independently.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Passion for natural skincare and wellness.
	Willingness to travel to meet potential clients when necessary.


Salary
N190,000 - N210,000 monthly (plus commission).

Application Closing Date: 10th November, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

2.) Coding & Robotics NYSC Intern (Service Year Opportunity)

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos

Who we are looking for


	Are you a recent science or non-core engineering graduate currently enrolled in NYSC, looking to build a career in tech but unsure of where to begin?
	This might just be the opportunity you've been waiting for!


Job Responsibilities


	Teach coding and robotics at partner schools
	Facilitate coding and robotics clubs twice a week, from 8:00 AM to 2:00 PM
	Assist in the setup and maintenance of hardware during training sessions.


Requirements


	Degree in Science or non-core engineering discipline (e.g., Chemistry, Microbiology, Agric Engineering, etc.)
	Must be a male NYSC corps member in Lagos State
	Genuine interest in tech and willingness to learn
	Must own a laptop and an Android device
	Passion for teaching and working with children.


Stipend
N30,000/month.

What You’ll Get:
Free Training in:


	Hardware programming
	Home automation
	Internet of Things (IoT).


Application Closing Date: 24th October, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Business Development Executive

Job Location: Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Business Development Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, building and maintaining client relationships, and driving revenue growth. This role requires a strategic thinker with excellent communication skills and a proven track record in sales or business development.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities to expand the company’s client base and market share
	Develop and implement strategic plans to achieve sales targets and revenue growth.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, partners, and stakeholders.
	Conduct market research to identify trends, customer needs, and competitive positioning.
	Prepare and deliver compelling presentations, proposals, and pitches to prospective clients.
	Collaborate with internal teams (e.g., marketing, product development, and operations) to align business development strategies with company goals.
	Negotiate contracts and close deals to secure profitable partnerships.
	Monitor and report on sales performance, market trends, and competitor activities.
	Attend industry events, conferences, and networking opportunities to promote the company and generate leads.
	Stay updated on industry developments and emerging opportunities.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field (MBA preferred).
	Proven experience (2 years) in business development, sales, or a similar role.
	Experience in the tech industry
	Strong understanding of market dynamics, customer behavior, and industry trends.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to think strategically and execute tactically.
	Proficiency in CRM software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Self-motivated, goal-oriented, and able to work independently.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 25th October, 2025.

title: Job Openings at Flutterwave
content:
Flutterwave was founded on the principle that every African must be able to participate and thrive in the global economy. To achieve this objective, we have built a trusted payment infrastructure that allows consumers and businesses (African and International) make and receive payments in a convenient border-less manner.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Head, Sales - Nigeria

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos

The Role
     

            
    




	Flutterwave is looking for an exceptional Head, Sales – Nigeria to lead enterprise commercial growth in our largest and most strategic market.
	This senior leadership role will drive revenue acceleration across enterprise payouts and collections, forge high-value partnerships, and establish Flutterwave as the dominant fintech infrastructure provider in Nigeria.
	Working out of our HQ in Lagos, Nigeria, this role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of digital payments across Africa’s largest economy while working directly with the executive team to deliver on ambitious growth targets.
	This role will have a dual reporting structure, reporting to the CEO and the Head, Enterprise Commercial Growth.


Responsibilities include but are not limited to
Enterprise Revenue Growth & Market Strategy:


	Own and deliver aggressive revenue targets for Nigeria’s enterprise segment, including banks, fintechs, e-commerce, multinationals, and other large corporates
	Design and execute enterprise go-to-market strategies to capture share, strengthen Flutterwave’s positioning, and deepen customer penetration
	Partner with executive leadership to define Nigeria’s enterprise growth strategy, including sector focus and resource allocation
	Establish and monitor KPIs, using data-driven performance management to maximize sales efficiency and profitability.


Enterprise Sales & Strategic Partnerships:


	Lead the acquisition of tier-1 enterprise clients with complex payout and collections requirements
	Identify, negotiate, and close large-scale partnerships with financial institutions, ecosystem leaders, and government-linked enterprises
	Oversee customer onboarding, solution deployment, and relationship management to drive retention, expansion, and enterprise stickiness
	Provide market intelligence on enterprise customer needs, competitor strategies, and regulatory developments.


Leadership & Sales Operations:


	Lead a high-performing enterprise sales organization, including account executives, business development managers, and customer success leads
	Implement world-class enterprise sales operations, including CRM discipline, pipeline management, deal governance, and forecasting rigor
	Collaborate closely with product, engineering, marketing, operations, and compliance to ensure seamless enterprise delivery and customer satisfaction
	Foster a performance-driven, customer-centric enterprise culture aligned with Flutterwave’s values.
	Ensures personal information of customers, employees, and other individuals the company conducts business with is processed and protected in line with applicable data privacy policies, privacy laws, and global best practices.”


Market Leadership & Stakeholder Engagement:


	Represent Flutterwave as the enterprise commercial leader in Nigeria, engaging senior executives, regulators, and key industry stakeholders
	Collaborate with compliance/legal to navigate CBN regulations and evolving fintech frameworks impacting enterprise solutions
	Deliver insights and recommendations to global leadership on enterprise trends, opportunities, and competitive threats.


Required competency and skillset to be a waver


	Minimum 15+ years of progressive commercial leadership
	Deep expertise in payments and financial services, with a proven record of leading enterprise growth in fintech, banking, or payments infrastructure
	Demonstrated success in closing enterprise deals exceeding $1M annually and managing revenue lines of $50M+
	Track record of building, scaling, and leading large enterprise sales teams (30+ professionals)
	In-depth knowledge of Nigeria’s enterprise payments infrastructure, regulatory frameworks, and financial ecosystem
	Strong grasp of collections, payouts, and API-driven solutions for large organizations
	Experience influencing enterprise stakeholders and engaging regulators
	Strategic thinker with the ability to translate enterprise opportunities into executable growth plans
	Strong executive presence; adept at engaging C-suite leaders, boards, and senior government officials
	Skilled in change management and leading enterprise teams through rapid scale
	Results-driven with a record of exceeding ambitious revenue targets


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Country Sales Lead, Nigeria

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time
Department: Enterprise Commercial Growth

The Role


	Flutterwave is looking for an exceptional Country Sales Head – Nigeria to lead enterprise commercial growth in our largest and most strategic market.
	This senior leadership role will drive revenue acceleration across enterprise payouts and collections, forge high-value partnerships, and establish Flutterwave as the dominant fintech infrastructure provider in Nigeria.
	Working out of our HQ in Lagos, Nigeria, this role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of digital payments across Africa’s largest economy while working directly with the executive team to deliver on ambitious growth targets.
	This role will have a dual reporting structure, reporting to the CEO and the Head, Enterprise Commercial Growth.


Responsibilities
Enterprise Revenue Growth & Market Strategy:


	Own and deliver aggressive revenue targets for Nigeria’s enterprise segment, including banks, fintechs, e-commerce, multinationals, and other large corporates
	Design and execute enterprise go-to-market strategies to capture share, strengthen Flutterwave’s positioning, and deepen customer penetration
	Partner with executive leadership to define Nigeria’s enterprise growth strategy, including sector focus and resource allocation
	Establish and monitor KPIs, using data-driven performance management to maximize sales efficiency and profitability.


Enterprise Sales & Strategic Partnerships:


	Lead the acquisition of tier-1 enterprise clients with complex payout and collections requirements
	Identify, negotiate, and close large-scale partnerships with financial institutions, ecosystem leaders, and government-linked enterprises
	Oversee customer onboarding, solution deployment, and relationship management to drive retention, expansion, and enterprise stickiness
	Provide market intelligence on enterprise customer needs, competitor strategies, and regulatory developments.


Leadership & Sales Operations:


	Lead a high-performing enterprise sales organization, including account executives, business development managers, and customer success leads
	Implement world-class enterprise sales operations, including CRM discipline, pipeline management, deal governance, and forecasting rigor
	Collaborate closely with product, engineering, marketing, operations, and compliance to ensure seamless enterprise delivery and customer satisfaction
	Foster a performance-driven, customer-centric enterprise culture aligned with Flutterwave’s values.
	Ensures personal information of customers, employees, and other individuals the company conducts business with is processed and protected in line with applicable data privacy policies, privacy laws, and global best practices.”


Market Leadership & Stakeholder Engagement:


	Represent Flutterwave as the enterprise commercial leader in Nigeria, engaging senior executives, regulators, and key industry stakeholders
	Collaborate with compliance/legal to navigate CBN regulations and evolving fintech frameworks impacting enterprise solutions
	Deliver insights and recommendations to global leadership on enterprise trends, opportunities, and competitive threats.


Requirements


	Minimum 15+ years of progressive commercial leadership
	Deep expertise in payments and financial services, with a proven record of leading enterprise growth in fintech, banking, or payments infrastructure
	Demonstrated success in closing enterprise deals exceeding $1M annually and managing revenue lines of $50M+
	Track record of building, scaling, and leading large enterprise sales teams (30+ professionals)
	In-depth knowledge of Nigeria’s enterprise payments infrastructure, regulatory frameworks, and financial ecosystem
	Strong grasp of collections, payouts, and API-driven solutions for large organizations
	Experience influencing enterprise stakeholders and engaging regulators
	Strategic thinker with the ability to translate enterprise opportunities into executable growth plans
	Strong executive presence; adept at engaging C-suite leaders, boards, and senior government officials
	Skilled in change management and leading enterprise teams through rapid scale
	Results-driven with a record of exceeding ambitious revenue targets


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Treasurer, Africa

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Category: Finance

Job Description


	The Treasurer, Africa will develop and execute Flutterwave's treasury strategy, manage financial risk, and optimize capital and liquidity.
	This role requires a strong understanding of financial markets, significant leadership experience, and the ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders.
	The Treasurer will play a crucial role in ensuring Flutterwave's financial stability and efficiency in the global financial landscape.


Responsibilities 
Strategy Development & Execution:


	Collaborate with senior management to develop and implement a comprehensive treasury strategy aligned with Flutterwave's overall business objectives.
	Lead the development and scaling of a treasury function, managing cash, investments, and liquidity across all major positions.
	Identify and capitalize on market opportunities to maximize profitability and manage risk, in collaboration with senior management.
	Work closely with the expansion team for banking partnerships and financial infrastructure.
	Monitor and analyze global economic and financial market developments and their potential impact on treasury operations.


Financial Risk Management:


	Establish and maintain robust financial risk management frameworks and policies (including FX, interest rate, and liquidity risks).
	Oversee the monitoring and management of financial exposure, including hedging strategies, to mitigate potential losses.
	Develop and implement hedging strategies.
	Support the implementation of a comprehensive risk management policy to cover financial and liquidity risks.
	Ensure compliance with all relevant regulatory requirements and internal controls.


Treasury Operations:


	Oversee the execution of treasury transactions, ensuring efficiency and accuracy.
	Manage relationships with banks, financial institutions, and other counterparties.
	Optimize treasury processes and systems to enhance performance.
	Analyze treasury performance and generate reports to improve profitability.
	Structure treasury deals for large merchants, including servicing our concierge merchants.
	Contribute to establishing pricing rules for remittance products and new products.
	Support new bank onboarding and financial activities.
	Ensure standard daily and periodic reporting and maintain process documentation for all relevant reports, including funding and liquidity metrics.


Capital & Liquidity Optimization:


	Develop and maintain pricing models to ensure competitiveness and profitability.
	Analyze and report on treasury performance, identifying areas for improvement.
	Support the CFO in capital planning, fundraising, and investment decisions.
	Evaluate and recommend investment opportunities for excess cash in low-risk instruments.
	Contribute to capital structure optimization and funding strategy (e.g. CP issuances, term loans, equity injections)


Stakeholder Management:


	Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including finance, product, and technology teams.
	Build and maintain relationships with external stakeholders, including banks, regulators, and industry associations.
	Present to senior management on treasury performance and strategy.
	Establish strong working partnerships externally with key banking partners and internal stakeholders.
	Ensure continuous and effective engagement of relevant stakeholders in achieving operational efficiency and financial growth.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, or a related field; Master's degree or relevant professional certifications (e.g., ACT, ACA, CFA, FRM, CTP) preferred.
	Minimum of 12 years of experience in treasury or financial management, with a developed network of financial partners.
	Experience & understanding of international payments, banking systems, Crypto and Defi workflow platforms.
	Good understanding of emerging markets and G10 financial operations and local regulations.
	Advanced proficiency in Excel, SQL, and relevant treasury tools.
	Experience or familiarity with all or some of Emerging Markets, FX, and remittances.
	Excellent financial analytical, strategic planning and execution skills.
	Strong leadership and team management abilities.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet set deadlines.
	Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills.
	Work goal-oriented and able to work under minimal supervision.
	High sense of responsibility, accountability, integrity, and ethical standards.
	Authorization to work in the country without sponsorship.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
	Experience with relevant treasury platforms and financial software.
	Experience in the African fintech space is a definite plus.


Click here to apply online

Simultaneously, as a social enterprise, they empower communities through sustainable micro-enterprise development, equipping individuals with the skills and resources to build small businesses. This dual model allows them to combine grant-funded interventions with market-driven solutions for lasting community empowerment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Finance Coordinator
     

            
    



Job Location: Jimeta Yola, Adamawa
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Bincike International is looking for a qualified Project Finance Coordinator to be based in Yola, Adamawa State, with frequent travel to Borno State.
	The ideal candidate will be a Chartered Accountant with a strong background in managing project finances for nonprofit organizations.
	This role is responsible for the overall financial management and oversight of all projects, ensuring compliance with both Bincike International policies and donor requirements, with a particular focus on UN finance systems.


Key Responsibilities


	Financial Management & Reporting: Oversee all financial transactions, including budgeting, forecasting, and expenditure tracking for multiple projects. Prepare and submit accurate and timely financial reports to management and donors, ensuring compliance with relevant financial standards.
	UN Financial Systems: Manage project funds and transactions using UN-specific financial systems and reporting templates. A strong knowledge of these systems is essential for this role.
	Compliance & Auditing: Ensure all financial activities are in line with Bincike International's financial policies, as well as donor-specific rules and regulations. Serve as the main point of contact for internal and external audits, providing all necessary documentation and explanations.
	Team Leadership & Capacity Building: Supervise and mentor junior finance staff, building their capacity in financial management and accounting principles.
	Travel & Coordination: Travel frequently to Borno State to oversee financial activities and provide support to field teams. Coordinate with project managers to ensure financial plans are aligned with project implementation.


Qualifications and Skills


	Educational Background: A Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Certification: Must be a Chartered Accountant and a member of a recognised finance or accounting body.
	Experience: A minimum of 4 years of experience in project finance management, preferably in the humanitarian or development sector. Demonstrated experience with UN financial systems is required.
